```{r}
set.seed(082421)
# creating 5 different categories, with different amounts of time they show up in the data
categories <- rep(letters[1:5], times = c(25, 15, 37, 40, 83))

# 200 observations with the mean and standard deviation
test_scores <- rnorm(n = 200, mean = 145.24, sd = 2.48)

# Making the categories act like categories rather than numerical values
categories <- as.factor(categories)
```

```{r}
# Observations (be careful R is case sensitive)
N = 200

# Quick way of showing you the frequencies of each category
table(categories)
```


```{r jp included}
library(tidyverse)
library(psych)

set.seed(082421)
data <- tibble(categories = rep(letters[1:5], times = c(25, 15, 37, 40, 83)),
                   test_scores = rnorm(n = 200, mean = 145.24, sd = 2.48),
                   normal_distribution = rnorm(n = 200, mean = 0, sd = 1))

data %>% 
  group_by(categories) %>% 
  summarize(n = n()) %>% 
  mutate(freq = n/sum(n)) %>% 
ggplot(aes(fct_reorder(categories, n), n)) + 
  geom_col(fill = "dodgerblue", color = "white") + 
  theme_minimal()

data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(test_scores)) + 
  geom_histogram(color = "white", fill = "dodgerblue", bins = 20) + 
  theme_minimal()

data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(normal_distribution)) + 
  geom_histogram(color = "white", fill = "dodgerblue", bins = 20) + 
  theme_minimal()
```


```{r}
table(categories)

# Frequency of category A
freq_a <- 25/N
freq_a

# Percent of category A
percent_a <- freq_a*100
percent_a

freq_b <- 15/N
freq_b

percent_b <- freq_b*100
percent_b
  
freq_c <- 37/N
freq_c

percent_c <- freq_c*100
percent_c
  
freq_d <- 40/N
freq_d

percent_d <- freq_d*100
percent_d
  
freq_e <- 83/N
freq_e

percent_e <- freq_e*100
percent_e
```

```{r}
# Just a way to combine all the percentages together to see in one place
cbind(percent_a, percent_b, percent_c, percent_d, percent_e)
```

```{r}
# To get the cumulative frequency of category A and B, I'll add them together
freq_ab <- freq_a + freq_b
freq_ab
```


```{r}
# To get the cumlative percentage of all 5 categories
total_percent <- percent_a + percent_b + percent_c + percent_d + percent_e
total_percent
```

```{r}
# find the median
sort(test_scores)
sort(test_scores)[100:101]

get_median <- (145.15 + 145.15)/2
get_median

median(test_scores)
```


```{r}
# look at test scores first
sort(test_scores)
N

# get the sum first
sigma_sum <- sum(test_scores)
sigma_sum

# get the mean from the sum of the scores
xbar <- sigma_sum/N
xbar
```

```{r}
# look at how far students deviated from the average score
deviation <- test_scores - xbar
deviation

# look to see how far the worse test score was from the mean
sort(deviation)
```

```{r}
# calculate the sum of the deviations
# what does this tell you?
sum(deviation)

```
